page.title: 08Farming-Commercial-Boynds
page.content: Boynds is a commercial farm situated on a hill looking south westerly over Inverurie and the Ury valley. Mr Murrison has only farmed these 250 acres for the last two years. The main enterprises are fattening cattle and growing barley for malting and cattle fodder. His cattle herd consists of a selection of cross breeds mainly Herefords, Charolais and Aberdeen Angus. These animals are bought at local markets when they are about 9 months to 1 year old and fattened and slaughtered within the next year. Approximately 50 acres of land borders the east bank of the River Ury and is susceptible to flooding.
